title: How to Get a Straight Line when Trimming a Hedge

steps.headline: Cut string the length of your hedge and some extra.
steps.description: The extra should be enough to wrap around and tie onto the stakes.

steps.headline: Set a stake at each end of the hedge that you are trimming.
steps.description: Hammer into the ground lightly. You can put in stakes and string lines lengthwise and width wise as needed.

steps.headline: Tie the string onto each stake.
steps.description: Match the level of the string with the height at which you want to trim the hedge. The string line will act as a guide to get a uniform height and width.

steps.headline: Trim the hedge down to the lowest point, following the string lines.
steps.description: The final look will be very professional.
